setup.title: BakLab Setup
setup.subtitle: Configure your BakLab application for production

init.welcome_description: This setup wizard will help you configure your BakLab application for production. Click the button below to generate a secure setup token and begin the configuration process.

database.title: Database Configuration
database.description: Configure your PostgreSQL database connection settings.
database.host_help: Hostname or IP address (e.g., localhost, db.example.com, 192.168.1.10)
database.host_error: Please enter a valid hostname or IP address
database.name_help: Start with letter, only letters/numbers/underscores (e.g., baklab, my_app_db)
database.name_error: Database name must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, and underscores (max 63 characters)
database.username_help: PostgreSQL username, start with letter (e.g., baklab, admin_user)
database.username_error: Username must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, and underscores (max 63 characters)
database.password_help: 12-64 characters with mixed types (letters, numbers, symbols)
database.password_error: Database password must be 12-64 characters with at least 3 types: lowercase, uppercase, numbers, special characters (!@#$%^&*)

redis.title: Redis Configuration
redis.description: Configure your Redis cache server settings.
redis.host_help: Redis server hostname or IP (e.g., localhost, redis.example.com, 192.168.1.20)
redis.host_error: Please enter a valid hostname or IP address
redis.password_help: 12-64 characters with mixed types (letters, numbers, symbols)
redis.password_error: Redis password must be 12-64 characters with at least 3 types: lowercase, uppercase, numbers, special characters (!@#$%^&*)

app.title: Application Configuration
app.description: Configure your application's basic settings and security options.
app.domain_error: Please enter a valid domain name (e.g., example.com) or localhost
app.email_help: System administrator email (used for TLS certificates and system notifications)
app.email_error: Please enter a valid email address
app.cors_help: Frontend URLs allowed to access your API. One per line. Format: https://domain.com or http://localhost:3000
app.cors_error: Each line should be a valid HTTP/HTTPS URL
app.language_help: Primary language for the application interface
app.jwt_section_description: Configure JWT signing key for authentication tokens. BakLab supports RSA and Ed25519 private keys. You can auto-generate a secure key or specify a host machine path for Docker volume mounting.
app.jwt_auto_description: A secure Ed25519 private key will be automatically generated for JWT signing. This is the recommended and most secure option.
app.jwt_file_help: Drop a JWT private key file here or click to select (.pem format only)
app.jwt_file_note: Required: PEM format private key (RSA or Ed25519)
app.jwt_path_help: Absolute path to JWT private key file (.pem) on host machine
app.jwt_path_required: JWT key file path is required
app.jwt_upload_required: Please upload a JWT key file first
app.jwt_generation_title: How to Generate JWT Private Key
app.jwt_generation_commands:
Ed25519 (Recommended):
openssl genpkey -algorithm Ed25519 -out jwt.pem

RSA-3072:
openssl genrsa -out jwt.pem 3072

Set proper permissions:
chmod 600 jwt.pem

ssl.title: SSL/HTTPS Configuration
ssl.description: Configure SSL certificates for HTTPS. You can either disable HTTPS (HTTP only) or provide certificate file paths for secure connections.
ssl.use_setup_cert_label: Use same certificates as setup program
ssl.use_setup_cert_help: Automatically fill in the certificate paths currently used by this setup program
ssl.cert_path_help: Full path to SSL certificate file (e.g., /etc/ssl/certs/domain.crt or /etc/letsencrypt/live/domain.com/fullchain.pem)
ssl.cert_path_required: Certificate path is required when SSL is enabled
ssl.key_path_help: Full path to SSL private key file (e.g., /etc/ssl/private/domain.key or /etc/letsencrypt/live/domain.com/privkey.pem)
ssl.key_path_required: Private key path is required when SSL is enabled

goaccess.title: Analytics & Monitoring
goaccess.description: Configure GoAccess real-time web analytics. This service provides detailed analysis of your website traffic and visitor behavior.
goaccess.geo_file_help: Drop a GeoLite2-City.mmdb file here or click to select
goaccess.geo_file_note: GeoIP database is required for geographic data visualization. Download free GeoLite2-City.mmdb from:
goaccess.file_too_large: File size too large. Maximum allowed size is 100MB
goaccess.geo_file_required: GeoIP database file is required when GoAccess is enabled

admin.title: Administrator User
admin.description: Create the initial administrator account for your application. The email defaults to the system admin email, but you can change it if needed.
admin.username_help: 4-20 characters, start/end with letters/numbers, can contain dots, underscores, hyphens
admin.username_error: Username must be 4-20 characters, start and end with alphanumeric characters
admin.email_help: Admin user login email (defaults to system admin email, can be different)
admin.email_error: Please enter a valid email address
admin.password_help: 12-64 characters with mixed types (letters, numbers, symbols)
admin.password_error: Password must be 12-64 characters with lowercase, uppercase, numbers, and special characters (!@#$%^&*)

review.title: Review Configuration
review.description: Please review your configuration before generating the configuration files.

config_complete.title: Configuration Complete!
config_complete.description: Your BakLab application has been successfully configured. You can now manually deploy using the generated configuration files.
config_complete.ready_description: Manual deployment: cd {{outputPath}} && docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml --env-file .env.production up -d

completed.title: Setup Complete!
completed.description: Your BakLab application has been successfully configured.
completed.congratulations: Congratulations! Your BakLab instance is now ready for use. The setup service remains available for future configuration updates.
steps_list: Access your application: Visit your domain to start using BakLab
Configuration updates: You can re-run setup anytime to update your configuration
Backups: Set up regular backups of your data and configuration
Monitoring: Monitor your services with docker-compose ps
Logs: Check logs with docker-compose logs -f

messages.setup_completed: Setup completed successfully! You can now start the main application.
messages.fix_errors: Please fix the validation errors below and try again.
